title: what's with all the hate for 4 man queues?
body:
almost every single time i've played in a 4 man queue the random says something like "great another 4 man" in champ select. is your team losing the game? random calls team trash and asks other team to report us for toxicity. i realize that sometimes the random can get ganged up on by 4 people, but in my experience both solo queueing and 4 man, I think the odds of the random spewing insults is much higher

the same is true of duo bot lanes. did you lose lane? gg duo bot trash. did you win lane? team says nothing

replies.body:
4 man premades are just convenient to blame. It's silly, but that describes the mentality of a lot of League players.

Premades are not inherently bad, just like solo players are not inherently bad. However, there is a tendency for one of the two to blame the other when things go pear shaped. This goes for both parties.

Reason for this is that one guy probably doesn't know what the hell your team is planning to do most of the times, as there is 0 communication considering that the 4 man is probably using some sort of Voice Programs (Curse, Skype, Discord, etc.) Leaving the solo guy out, and often enough, the people in 4 mans try to do some sort of silly plays for the sake of fun, which often frustrates that one guy. This is why 4 mans are hated often.

Whenever I'm in a premade I always post the curse voice link so everyone else on our team can join. Funny enough only about 10% actually join and the ones who don't join then complain we don't communicate enough. Can't make some people happy.
A lot of people have social anxiety which prevents them from voicechatting.

I don't expect people to chat. I expect them to join the call so they can LISTEN. There are plenty of times I can't talk when we're playing late at night because my wife is asleep and our walls are paper thin but I still join the calls and listen to the communication.

Just say your mic is broken if you don't want to chat.
While you may do this, a vast majority of people choose not to share any sort of link, remember, you do account for everyone. Also apply what Tiny Trickster said.

I can think of a few situations.

1. 4-man premade refuse to ping because they are all on comms. That leaves the solo player at a disadvantage where they can and likely will be caught out.
2. 4-man premade defend their friend when they make a mistake leaving the solo player frustrated and feeling like they are facing a pointless task.
3. 4-man premade troll or don't play seriously resulting in a frustrating game for the solo player. It's fun when it's all 5 friends messing around, it isn't fun when you aren't part of it.

As for duo bot lanes I have a special hatred for those as a solo player. They have the advantage of likely playing together at least a few times already, they have communications and picked their champions based on each other's strengths. Facing that as a solo player you have a support / adc that you don't know, who most likely picked a support / adc they are comfortable with that you may not work well with and at best you can hope they use pings smartly and ward.
4 mans inconsiderately force a solo to fill their gap and deal with their shit for 35 minutes.

Inconsiderate how? Either way it's still 5 people. And what 'shit' does the solo player have to deal with? 4 man premades are not douchebags by default, and claiming they are is simply a discriminatory mindset.

Logically speaking, 4 man premades are likely to be in voicechat or communicate with each other more than their solo teammate. They're also much more concerned with their premade than the solo player, so the solo is often left to fend for themselves. It doesn't feel good to get carried by a 4 man, get stomped by a 4 man, get trolled by a 4 man, or get harassed by a 4 man. Premades are cancer for solo players.

I frequently play solo, and in premade groups of sizes 2-4. Maybe it's just the group that I play with and the groups I end up with when solo, but I barely ever see the issues you're bringing up. I always see it as there being 5 people. Sure, I might be in the same room as 3 of them, but we still need the 5th one to do well. I, and the people I play with understand that.

A more accurate closing statement for your above post would be premades **_can be_** cancer for solo players. Of course, solo players can be cancer for solo players too. Premades are no different from randoms. We're all here to win and hopefully have some fun while we do. Premades are not inherently bad or good, and the same goes for solo players.

> Whenever I'm in a premade I always post the curse voice link so everyone else on our team can join. Funny enough only about 10% actually join and the ones who don't join then complain we don't communicate enough. Can't make some people happy.

This, so much of this.

they alienate their odd man out, always assuming they are the team and we are here to fill in what they need. they rarely communicate with this other random fill their intentions and its just assumed you are going to do what they want to do.

its a team game, and you already consider me to be your subordinate and what you want to do is always right.
